001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.lang.StackWalker.Option;
004import java.lang.StackWalker.StackFrame;
005import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
006import java.time.Instant;
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008import java.util.List;
009import java.util.function.Supplier;
010
011import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
012
013import io.jstach.rainbowgum.KeyValues.MutableKeyValues;
014import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEvent.Builder;
015import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEvent.Caller;
016import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogRouter.Router;
017
018/**
019 * A LogEvent is a container for a single call to a logger. An event should not be created
020 * unless a route or logger is actually enabled.
021 *
022 * @author agentgt
023 * @apiNote LogEvent is currently sealed. The reason there are so many static creation
024 * methods is for optimization purposes because other than actual outputting creating
025 * events is generally the most expensive operation (mostly in terms of memory) a logging
026 * system does.
027 * @see LogMessageFormatter
028 */
029public sealed interface LogEvent {
030
031        /**
032         * Creates a log event.
033         * @param level the logging level.
034         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
035         * @param formattedMessage the unformatted message.
036         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
037         * @param throwable an exception if passed maybe <code>null</code>.
038         * @return event
039         * @see LevelResolver
040         * @apiNote the message is already assumed to be formatted as no arguments are passed.
041         */
042        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String formattedMessage,
043                        KeyValues keyValues, @Nullable Throwable throwable) {
044                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
045                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
046                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
047                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
048
049                return new DefaultLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, keyValues,
050                                throwable);
051
052        }
053
054        /**
055         * Creates a log event.
056         * @param level the logging level.
057         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
058         * @param formattedMessage the unformatted message.
059         * @param throwable an exception if passed maybe <code>null</code>.
060         * @return event
061         * @see LevelResolver
062         * @apiNote the message is already assumed to be formatted as no arguments are passed.
063         */
064        static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String formattedMessage,
065                        @Nullable Throwable throwable) {
066                return of(level, loggerName, formattedMessage, KeyValues.of(), throwable);
067        }
068
069        /**
070         * Creates a log event.
071         * @param level the logging level.
072         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
073         * @param message the unformatted message.
074         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
075         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
076         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
077         * @param arg1 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
078         * @return event
079         * @see LevelResolver
080         * @see LogMessageFormatter
081         */
082        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
083                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object arg1) {
084                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
085                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
086                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
087                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
088                return new OneArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
089                                messageFormatter, null, arg1);
090        }
091
092        /**
093         * Creates a log event.
094         * @param level the logging level.
095         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
096         * @param message the unformatted message.
097         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
098         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
099         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
100         * @param arg1 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
101         * @param arg2 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
102         * @return event
103         * @see LevelResolver
104         * @see LogMessageFormatter
105         */
106        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
107                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2) {
108                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
109                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
110                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
111                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
112                return new TwoArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
113                                messageFormatter, null, arg1, arg2);
114        }
115
116        /**
117         * Creates a log event.
118         * @param level the logging level.
119         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
120         * @param message the unformatted message.
121         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
122         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
123         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
124         * @param args an array of arguments that will be passed to messageFormatter. The
125         * contents maybe null elements but the array itself should not be null.
126         * @return event
127         * @see LevelResolver
128         * @see LogMessageFormatter
129         */
130        public static LogEvent ofArgs(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
131                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object[] args) {
132                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
133                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
134                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
135                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
136                return new ArrayArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
137                                messageFormatter, null, args);
138        }
139
140        /**
141         * Creates a log event with everything specified.
142         * @param timestamp time of event
143         * @param threadName or empty string
144         * @param threadId thread id or 0 if that cannot be resolved.
145         * @param level the logging level.
146         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
147         * @param message the unformatted message.
148         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
149         * @param throwable or <code>null</code>.
150         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
151         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
152         * @param args an array of arguments that will be passed to messageFormatter. The
153         * contents maybe null elements but the array itself should not be null.
154         * @return event
155         * @see LevelResolver
156         * @see LogMessageFormatter
157         */
158        public static LogEvent ofAll(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level,
159                        String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues, @Nullable Throwable throwable,
160                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @SuppressWarnings("exports") @Nullable List<@Nullable Object> args) {
161
162                if (args == null) {
163                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
164                                        throwable);
165                }
166                int size = args.size();
167                return switch (size) {
168                        case 0 ->
169                                new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues, throwable);
170                        case 1 -> new OneArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
171                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.get(0));
172                        case 2 -> new TwoArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
173                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.get(0), args.get(1));
174                        default -> new ArrayArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
175                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.toArray());
176                };
177        }
178
179        /**
180         * Creates a log event with everything specified.
181         * @param timestamp time of event
182         * @param threadName or empty string
183         * @param threadId thread id or 0 if that cannot be resolved.
184         * @param level the logging level.
185         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
186         * @param message the unformatted message.
187         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
188         * @param throwable or <code>null</code>.
189         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
190         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
191         * @param args an array of arguments that will be passed to messageFormatter. The
192         * contents maybe null elements but the array itself should not be null.
193         * @return event
194         * @see LevelResolver
195         * @see LogMessageFormatter
196         */
197        public static LogEvent ofAll(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level,
198                        String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues, @Nullable Throwable throwable,
199                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @SuppressWarnings("exports") @Nullable Object @Nullable [] args) {
200
201                if (args == null) {
202                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
203                                        throwable);
204                }
205                int size = args == null ? 0 : args.length;
206                return switch (size) {
207                        case 0 ->
208                                new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues, throwable);
209                        case 1 -> new OneArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
210                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args[0]);
211                        case 2 -> new TwoArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
212                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args[0], args[1]);
213                        default -> new ArrayArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
214                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args);
215                };
216        }
217
218        /**
219         * Creates a new event with the caller info attached. <em> This method always returns
220         * a new event does not check if the original has caller info. </em>
221         * @param event original event.
222         * @param caller caller info.
223         * @return new log event.
224         */
225        public static LogEvent withCaller(LogEvent event, Caller caller) {
226                return new StackFrameLogEvent(event, caller);
227        }
228
229        /**
230         * Timestamp when the event was created.
231         * @return instant when the event was created.
232         */
233        public Instant timestamp();
234
235        /**
236         * Name of the thread.
237         * @return thread name.
238         * @apiNote this maybe empty and often is if virtual threads are used.
239         */
240        public String threadName();
241
242        /**
243         * Thread id.
244         * @return thread id.
245         */
246        public long threadId();
247
248        /**
249         * The logging level. {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level#ALL} and
250         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level#OFF} should not be returned as they have
251         * special meaning.
252         * @return level.
253         */
254        public System.Logger.Level level();
255
256        /**
257         * Name of logger.
258         * @return name of logger.
259         */
260        public String loggerName();
261
262        /**
263         * Unformatted message.
264         * @return unformatted message
265         * @see #formattedMessage(StringBuilder)
266         */
267        public String message();
268
269        /**
270         * Appends the formatted message.
271         * @param sb string builder to use.
272         * @see LogMessageFormatter
273         */
274        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb);
275
276        /**
277         * Throwable at the time of the event passed from the logger.
278         * @return if the event does not have a throwable <code>null</code> will be returned.
279         */
280        public @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull();
281
282        /**
283         * Key values that usually come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
284         * @return key values.
285         */
286        public KeyValues keyValues();
287
288        /**
289         * Returns info about caller or <code>null</code> if not supported.
290         * @return caller info
291         */
292        default @Nullable Caller callerOrNull() {
293                return null;
294        }
295
296        /**
297         * Freeze will return a LogEvent that is safe to use in a different thread. Usually
298         * this entails copying the data or checking if it is already immutable. Freeze should
299         * be called before passing an event to an {@link LogPublisher.AsyncLogPublisher}.
300         * @return thread safe log event.
301         */
302        public LogEvent freeze();
303
304        /**
305         * Freeze and replace with the given timestamp.
306         * @param timestamp instant to replace timestamp in this.
307         * @return a copy of this with the given timestamp.
308         */
309        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp);
310
311        /**
312         * A builder to create events by calling {@link Router#eventBuilder(String, Level)}.
313         * <strong>{@link #log()}</strong> should be called at the very end otherwise the
314         * event will not be logged. <strong> Because of potential future optimizations (see
315         * API note) It is best to assume this builder returns a different builder on every
316         * setter call even if it may not currently! </strong>
317         *
318         * @apiNote unless the builder gets marked for escape analysis the static
319         * {@link LogEvent} factory methods are more likely to be superior in performance. EA
320         * is tricky business and often requires the object be small enough and should not
321         * leave the method it is constructed in but the JDK is continuously getting better
322         * optimizing immutable objects. Thus it is best to assume this builder will return a
323         * different builder on every call.
324         */
325        public sealed interface Builder {
326
327                /**
328                 * Timestamp when the event was created.
329                 * @param timestamp time the event happened.
330                 * @return this.
331                 */
332                public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp);
333
334                /**
335                 * Add an argument to the event being built.
336                 * @param argSupplier supplier will be called immediately if this event is to be
337                 * logged.
338                 * @return this.
339                 */
340                Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier);
341
342                /**
343                 * Add an argument to the event being built.
344                 * @param arg maybe null.
345                 * @return this.
346                 */
347                Builder arg(@Nullable Object arg);
348
349                /**
350                 * Sets the message formatter which interpolates argument place holders.
351                 * @param messageFormatter formatter if not set
352                 * {@link LogMessageFormatter.StandardMessageFormatter#SLF4J} will be used.
353                 * @return this.
354                 */
355                public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter);
356
357                /**
358                 * Name of the thread.
359                 * @param threadName name of thread.
360                 * @return this.
361                 * @apiNote this maybe empty and often is if virtual threads are used.
362                 */
363                public Builder threadName(String threadName);
364
365                /**
366                 * Thread id.
367                 * @param threadId {@link Thread#getId()}.
368                 * @return this.
369                 */
370                public Builder threadId(long threadId);
371
372                /**
373                 * Unformatted message.
374                 * @param message unformatted message.
375                 * @return unformatted message
376                 */
377                public Builder message(String message);
378
379                /**
380                 * Throwable at the time of the event passed from the logger.
381                 * @param throwable exception at the time of the event.
382                 * @return if the event does not have a throwable <code>null</code> will be
383                 * returned.
384                 */
385                public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable);
386
387                /**
388                 * Key values that usually come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
389                 * @param keyValues will use the passed in key values for the event.
390                 * @return key values.
391                 */
392                public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues);
393
394                /**
395                 * Adds caller info.
396                 * @param caller caller maybe <code>null</code>.
397                 * @return this.
398                 */
399                public Builder caller(@Nullable Caller caller);
400
401                /**
402                 * Will log the event with the current values.
403                 * @return true if accepted.
404                 */
405                public boolean log();
406
407                /**
408                 * Will generate the event if the router can accept otherwise <code>null</code>.
409                 * @return event or <code>null</code>.
410                 * @apiNote The event is not logged but just created if possible if logging is
411                 * desired use {@link #log()} or check if the return is not <code>null</code> and
412                 * then log.
413                 */
414                public @Nullable LogEvent eventOrNull();
415
416        }
417
418        /**
419         * Caller info usually derived from Stack walking.
420         */
421        public sealed interface Caller {
422
423                /**
424                 * Creates caller info from a stack frame.
425                 * @param stackFrame stack frame must have
426                 * {@link java.lang.StackWalker.Option#RETAIN_CLASS_REFERENCE}.
427                 * @return caller info.
428                 */
429                public static Caller of(StackFrame stackFrame) {
430                        return new StackFrameCallerInfo(stackFrame);
431                }
432
433                /**
434                 * Returns caller from a certain depth or <code>null</code>
435                 * @param depth how deep in the stack to pull stack frame.
436                 * @return caller or <code>null</code>.
437                 */
438                public static @Nullable Caller ofDepthOrNull(int depth) {
439                        return StackFrameCallerInfo.stackWalker.<@Nullable Caller>walk(
440                                        s -> s.skip(depth + 1).limit(1).map(f -> Caller.of(f)).findFirst().orElse(null));
441                }
442
443                /**
444                 * See {@link StackFrame#getClassName()}.
445                 * @return class name.
446                 */
447                public String className();
448
449                /**
450                 * See {@link StackFrame#getFileName()}.
451                 * @return file name.
452                 */
453                public @Nullable String fileNameOrNull();
454
455                /**
456                 * See {@link StackFrame#getLineNumber()}.
457                 * @return line number.
458                 */
459                public int lineNumber();
460
461                /**
462                 * See {@link StackFrame#getMethodName()}.
463                 * @return method name.
464                 */
465                public String methodName();
466
467                /**
468                 * Make the caller info immutable.
469                 * @return immutable caller info and if this is already immutable return this.
470                 */
471                public Caller freeze();
472
473        }
474
475}
476
477record FrozenCallerInfo(String className, @Nullable String fileNameOrNull, int lineNumber,
478                String methodName) implements LogEvent.Caller {
479        @Override
480        public Caller freeze() {
481                return this;
482        }
483}
484
485record StackFrameCallerInfo(StackFrame stackFrame) implements LogEvent.Caller {
486
487        static final StackWalker stackWalker = StackWalker.getInstance(Option.RETAIN_CLASS_REFERENCE);
488
489        @Override
490        public String className() {
491                return stackFrame.getClassName();
492        }
493
494        @Override
495        public @Nullable String fileNameOrNull() {
496                /*
497                 * TODO checker did not know file name is null.
498                 */
499                return stackFrame.getFileName();
500        }
501
502        @Override
503        public int lineNumber() {
504                return stackFrame.getLineNumber();
505        }
506
507        @Override
508        public String methodName() {
509                return stackFrame.getMethodName();
510        }
511
512        @Override
513        public Caller freeze() {
514                return new FrozenCallerInfo(className(), fileNameOrNull(), lineNumber(), methodName());
515        }
516
517}
518
519final class LogEventBuilder implements LogEvent.Builder {
520
521        private final LogEventLogger logger;
522
523        private final Level level;
524
525        private final String loggerName;
526
527        private Instant timestamp = Instant.now();
528
529        private String threadName = Thread.currentThread().getName();
530
531        private long threadId = Thread.currentThread().threadId();
532
533        private String message = "";
534
535        private @Nullable Throwable throwable;
536
537        private KeyValues keyValues = KeyValues.of();
538
539        private @Nullable List<@Nullable Object> args = null;
540
541        private LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter = LogMessageFormatter.StandardMessageFormatter.SLF4J;
542
543        private @Nullable Caller caller = null;
544
545        LogEventBuilder(LogEventLogger logger, Level level, String loggerName) {
546                super();
547                this.logger = logger;
548                this.level = level;
549                this.loggerName = loggerName;
550        }
551
552        @Override
553        public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp) {
554                this.timestamp = timestamp;
555                return this;
556        }
557
558        @Override
559        public Builder threadName(String threadName) {
560                this.threadName = threadName;
561                return this;
562        }
563
564        @Override
565        public Builder threadId(long threadId) {
566                this.threadId = threadId;
567                return this;
568        }
569
570        @Override
571        public Builder message(String message) {
572                this.message = message;
573                return this;
574        }
575
576        @Override
577        public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter) {
578                this.messageFormatter = messageFormatter;
579                return this;
580        }
581
582        @Override
583        public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable) {
584                this.throwable = throwable;
585                return this;
586        }
587
588        @Override
589        public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues) {
590                this.keyValues = keyValues;
591                return this;
592        }
593
594        @Override
595        public Builder arg(@Nullable Object arg) {
596                var list = this.args;
597                if (list == null) {
598                        list = this.args = new ArrayList<>();
599                }
600                list.add(arg);
601                return this;
602        }
603
604        @Override
605        public Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier) {
606                return arg(argSupplier.get());
607        }
608
609        @Override
610        public Builder caller(@Nullable Caller caller) {
611                this.caller = caller;
612                return this;
613        }
614
615        @Override
616        public boolean log() {
617                var event = eventOrNull();
618                logger.log(event);
619                return true;
620        }
621
622        @Override
623        public LogEvent eventOrNull() {
624                var event = LogEvent.ofAll(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues, throwable,
625                                messageFormatter, this.args);
626                var c = caller;
627                if (c != null) {
628                        return LogEvent.withCaller(event, c);
629                }
630                return event;
631        }
632
633}
634
635enum NoOpLogEventBuilder implements LogEvent.Builder {
636
637        NOOP;
638
639        @Override
640        public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp) {
641                return this;
642        }
643
644        @Override
645        public Builder threadName(String threadName) {
646                return this;
647        }
648
649        @Override
650        public Builder threadId(long threadId) {
651                return this;
652        }
653
654        @Override
655        public Builder message(String message) {
656                return this;
657        }
658
659        @Override
660        public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable) {
661                return this;
662        }
663
664        @Override
665        public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues) {
666                return this;
667        }
668
669        @Override
670        public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter) {
671                return this;
672        }
673
674        @Override
675        public boolean log() {
676                return false;
677        }
678
679        @Override
680        public @Nullable LogEvent eventOrNull() {
681                return null;
682        }
683
684        @Override
685        public Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier) {
686                return this;
687        }
688
689        @Override
690        public Builder arg(@Nullable Object arg) {
691                return this;
692        }
693
694        @Override
695        public Builder caller(@Nullable Caller caller) {
696                return this;
697        }
698
699}
700
701record OneArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName,
702                String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull,
703                @Nullable Object arg1) implements LogEvent {
704
705        @Override
706        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
707                messageFormatter.format(sb, message, arg1);
708        }
709
710        @Override
711        public LogEvent freeze() {
712                return freeze(timestamp);
713        }
714
715        @Override
716        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
717                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
718                formattedMessage(sb);
719                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
720                                keyValues.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
721        }
722
723}
724
725record TwoArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName,
726                String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull,
727                @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2) implements LogEvent {
728
729        @Override
730        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
731                messageFormatter.format(sb, message, arg1, arg2);
732        }
733
734        @Override
735        public LogEvent freeze() {
736                return freeze(timestamp);
737        }
738
739        @Override
740        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
741                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
742                formattedMessage(sb);
743                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
744                                keyValues.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
745        }
746}
747
748record ArrayArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level,
749                String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter,
750                @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull, @Nullable Object[] args) implements LogEvent {
751
752        @Override
753        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
754                messageFormatter.formatArray(sb, message, args);
755        }
756
757        public int argCount() {
758                return args.length;
759        }
760
761        @Override
762        public LogEvent freeze() {
763                return freeze(timestamp);
764        }
765
766        @Override
767        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
768                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
769                formattedMessage(sb);
770                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
771                                keyValues.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
772        }
773
774}
775
776record DefaultLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level,
777                String loggerName, String formattedMessage, KeyValues keyValues,
778                @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull) implements LogEvent {
779
780        @Override
781        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
782                sb.append(this.formattedMessage);
783        }
784
785        @Override
786        public String message() {
787                return this.formattedMessage;
788        }
789
790        @Override
791        public LogEvent freeze() {
792                if (keyValues instanceof MutableKeyValues mkvs) {
793                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage,
794                                        mkvs.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
795                }
796                return this;
797        }
798
799        @Override
800        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
801                if (keyValues instanceof MutableKeyValues mkvs) {
802                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage,
803                                        mkvs.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
804                }
805                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, keyValues,
806                                throwableOrNull);
807        }
808
809}
810
811record StackFrameLogEvent(LogEvent event, Caller callerOrNull) implements LogEvent {
812
813        @Override
814        public Instant timestamp() {
815                return event.timestamp();
816        }
817
818        @Override
819        public String threadName() {
820                return event.threadName();
821        }
822
823        @Override
824        public long threadId() {
825                return event.threadId();
826        }
827
828        @Override
829        public Level level() {
830                return event.level();
831        }
832
833        @Override
834        public String loggerName() {
835                return event.loggerName();
836        }
837
838        @Override
839        public String message() {
840                return event.message();
841        }
842
843        @Override
844        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
845                event.formattedMessage(sb);
846
847        }
848
849        @Override
850        public @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull() {
851                return event.throwableOrNull();
852        }
853
854        @Override
855        public KeyValues keyValues() {
856                return event.keyValues();
857        }
858
859        @Override
860        public LogEvent freeze() {
861                var e = event.freeze();
862                var info = callerOrNull.freeze();
863                if (e == event && info == callerOrNull) {
864                        return this;
865                }
866
867                return new StackFrameLogEvent(e, info);
868        }
869
870        @Override
871        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
872                var e = event.freeze(timestamp);
873                var info = callerOrNull.freeze();
874                if (e == event && info == callerOrNull) {
875                        return this;
876                }
877                return new StackFrameLogEvent(e, info);
878        }
879
880}
